author: Oluwaseun ADEPOJU
title: Teens Blockchain Summer Bootcamp
description: "In most parts of Africa, ignorance and poor education about Blockchain technology has led to a lot of misconceptions"

assessments.note: Having such a camp, teaching young people about the future what waits is highly beneficial. For future plans it opens up awareness and another occasions, wider scale adaptation. The timetable breakdown contains useful content.

These types of activities could definitely help ADA grow in the long term.  However more details should be provided on the size of this bootcamp. How many student are you going to educate for 5 days given you are asking for $30,000.

A blockchain bootcamp sounds like a great idea. Getting information out there helps to build the community and to educate the people about the blockchain space. Once a bootcamp was done there is always an option to scale this up and to a second, third etc. version. Getting the information out there is one of the most important things.

The proposal dialogues very well with the objectives of the challenge, because it works directly to bring knowledge about Blockchain to young Africans, benefiting the community and cultivating fertile soil for future Cardano projects. The camp would be composed almost entirely by Africans, and the project would probably continue to bear fruit after the end of the event itself, since these young people would continue to study, and in the future work in the area, if they have a good direction. Note: 5.

The age group this proposal is aimed for might be too young. Maybe it can be raised a bit, even though I understand the possibilities that can be achieved if talented children start learning about blockchain at a young age.

This proposal identifies a problem that it can address and does address the challenge question "how do we seed and grow Cardano in Africa?" However, the bootcamp outline is vague in nature and the details of implementation are lacking. It is a great idea, there simply isn't a clear plan laid out that makes me assess at a 3, 4, or 5 level. Generally, I would consider this concept scalable, but again no details to prove if it is.

The idea is good, and it would be a good way to introduce teenagers into the blockchain and Cardano ecosystems. The plan is very well explained in the attachment. My only comment would be to include more information in the proposal text itself, some summary, to make it easier for voters to better understand the proposal.

The connection of the proposer contacts with the linked institute is unclear for me. I would maybe expect some previous occasions or if this is the first time, some more detailed plan from organisation point  of view. Attendance information is also, missing, what everything the required costs are covering. How the youngsters will be selected, how they'll know about. Will it be free, or the requested founds are for orga only? These points would be necessary to answer in order that the proposal succeeds in my eyes.

The entity should be able to do this given their claimed experience. However the plan is very thin on details. It doesn't state when it would be, where it would be and how many students it would target. Would they also be charging students? How are they selecting students? $30,000 is a lot of money for a summer bootcamp.

It would be nice to have a little bit more information regarding how the budget is allocated. The proposer are already committed as the Insitiute already engages in several fields. It is an advantage that there is a whole Institution behind the proposal and not just one person.

The idea is launched by the "Africa Blockchain Institute", a group already experienced in decentralizing knowledge about these technologies. Attached is a website that talks about the group, shows photos of the members with their respective performances and explains very well how the activities are carried out. Through the attached website, a lot of confidence is given to the team that proposes to carry out the camp, the idea of who is there and doing what is very well structured.
The initiative is based on a good premise, that with their knowledge and plan can be successfully implemented.
Very little evidence given that proposer(s) have relevant skills to organize, market, implement, and teach a coding bootcamp for teenagers in Africa. No budget provided. No risks addressed.

The institute behind this initiative seems to very competent and engaged with the development and traction of blockchain in Africa. The roadmap is clear, budget is well explained, and the project itself it not so difficult to execute, so I believe that this proposal is completely feasible.

The dates of the camp are given, but the way there is missing. To organise this in 3 months is quite intensive and since the dates are given I would look for more detailed plan about how to get there. I really hope that it exists and the voters will see the potential of this project.
This proposal is a asking for a lot of money without providing any information on the number of students it would educate, or where those students would be from, how they would be chosen etc.

The proposal is a little short which makes it hard to asses. The provided breakdown of the bootcamp helps to see how they plan to do it. But still it would help to provide more information regarding from where they take the information they plan to teach and where exactly the money is going. Also an introduction of the team would benefit instead of just linking the website.

A document was attached with an exact planning of the camp's activities, which would happen on which day. All separated into clear topics, the information is passed on very successfully. It is certain that the group has well-established goals to fulfill, which is fundamental for the success of any project. I have just a few observations: it would be interesting to better understand how the money received for the investment would be used, how much would be spent at each stage, where the camp would take place, how many young people would participate in the project and so on. They are details. I also missed a bit of lightness in the event's schedule, after all we would be dealing with young people, and introducing the subject in a light, didactic and escalating way with recreational activities would be very beneficial. But overall, I really liked this project.

Just having a big number of children participating in these bootcamps is not enough to assess the success of the project. There needs to be a way to assess how many of those children have remained interested in blockchain, Cardano or have even begun developing skills that would help them navigate the ecosystem.

I am giving a 1 in auditability because no key metrics or KPIs were identified foe measuring sucess. The only milestones are the broad agenda for the bootcamp given. Proposal does not explain why this boot camp addresses the challenge problem.

All the information to make the proposal auditable is there: roadmap, milestones, KPIs. Also, the foreseen dates are clear and reasonable. It seems that there are no major risks related to this project, but I believe it would be good to have some information regarding that in the text. But I believe that this proposal is completely auditable.

solution: Organize a summer Bootcamp for teenagers between the ages of (13 - 19 years old) in order to begin to introduce them to Blockchain.
experience: The Africa Blockchain Institute is vast in research, education, training and acceleration of blockchain in Africa.
